Package com.github.yeetmanlord.bedwars_zeta.api.bedwars_menus.items

Interface ICustomMenuItem

All Superinterfaces:
IMenuItem
All Known Implementing Classes:
CustomNonBuyableShopItem, CustomShopItem, CustomUpgradeItem, ExampleBuyableItem, ExampleCustomUpgradeItem, ExampleNonBuyableItem
public interface ICustomMenuItem extends IMenuItem
This interface is used to create custom items for the bedwars menus. To create a custom item extend this interface and override the methods. You must also override the IMenuItem.getSQLData() method to return a Row object that contains the data for the item. This data will be used to save the item to the database.
Author:
YeetManLord
See Also:
  • CustomShopItem
Implementation Note:
You must also implement a static read, sqlRead, and instantiation method in order to register this object. The read method is used to read the item from a config file. The sqlRead method is used to read the item from a database. The instantiation method is used to instantiate the item from the function selection menu.

  • Method Details

    • getCustomFunction

      String getCustomFunction()
      This function is used to get the function name of a custom item in order to store it in files and databases. Override this method and return a custom function name that you will check to see if an item is the item you are looking for. Then load that item and add it to the page.
      Returns:
      Item classes custom function name
      API Example:
      For custom item MyCustomItem you would return "my_plugin:my_custom_item_function"
      As a real example:
      public String getCustomFunction() {
        return "bedwars_addons:fireball";
      }

    • writeToMap

      Map<String,Object> writeToMap()
      Used to write the event to a map. This is used when writing to a config file. This should only include the data that is not already ina the super class.
      Returns:
      A map form of the event.

    • getSettingsMenu

      AbstractGUIMenu getSettingsMenu(AbstractGUIMenu parent)
      Used to configure the settings menu for this event. This is opened in the ShopSlotConfigurationMenu
      Parameters:
      parent - The parent menu.
      Returns:
      An instance of the settings menu.
